com.dautelle.math
Class Real

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Number
      com.dautelle.math.RealtimeNumber
          com.dautelle.math.Real
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable, Operable, Realtime, Representable, java.io.Serializable
public final class Real
extends RealtimeNumber
implements java.lang.Comparable, Operable, Representable

This class represents a real number of arbitrary precision (WORK IN PROGRESS).

The class resembles java.lang.BigDecimal but "scale manipulation" is unnecessary as the internal scale is automatically derived from the actual precision.

The current precision of any Real instance is accessible (see getAbsoluteError(), getRelativeError()) and guaranteed (the true/exact value is always within the precision range)!

Operations on instances of this class are quite fast as information substantially below the precision level (aka noise) is not processed/stored. There is no limit on a Real precision but precision degenerates (due to numeric errors) as more and more operations are performed.

Instances of this class can be utilized to find approximate solutions to linear equations using the Matrix class for which high-precision reals is often required, the primitive type double being not accurate enough to resolve equations when the matrix's size exceeds 100x100. Furthermore, even for small matrices the "qualified" result is indicative of possible system singularities.

Version:
6.0, February 1, 2004
Author:
Jean-Marie Dautelle
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

valueOf

public static Real valueOf(LargeInteger mantissa,
                           LargeInteger error,
                           int log2Scale)
Constructs a Real from the specified mantissa, error and scale ((mantissa ± error) * 2log2Scale).

Parameters:
mantissa - the mantissa.
error - the error on the mantissa.
log2Scale - the log base 2 of the scale multiplier.

valueOf

public static Real valueOf(java.lang.CharSequence chars)
Returns the Real for the specified character sequence. If the precision is not specified (using the ± symbol), the number of digits is characteristic of the precision. Example of valid character sequences for 1.2 ± 0.001:
  • "1.200"
  • "1.2±0.001
  • "1200±1E-3

Parameters:
chars - the character sequence.
Returns:
the corresponding real number.

valueOf

public static Real valueOf(XmlElement xml)
XML factory method.

Parameters:
xml - the XML element describing the real to return (e.g. <math:Real value="1.23000"/>).
Returns:
a new Real number as described by the specified xml element.

isZero

public boolean isZero()
Indicates if this Real is equal to ZERO. Zero reals are the only reals in existence with "exact" precision.

Returns:
true if this real is zero (exact); false otherwise.

isUnknown

public boolean isUnknown()
Indicates if this Real is unknown. Unknown reals are always different from any other reals or themselves.

Returns:
true if this real possible values are unknown; false otherwise.

approxEquals

public boolean approxEquals(Real that)
Indicates if this Real is approximately equals to the one specified. This method takes into account possible errors (e.g. numeric errors) to make this determination.

Note: This method always returns false if this or that is unknown.

Parameters:
that - the real to compare with.
Returns:
this ≊ that
